@fdsalkj 1080i isn't 540p. 1080 is the resolution "i" means it is interlaced "p" means progressive. The correlation of i and p is referring to the frame rate in frames per second. Where 30i is 15p and 30p is 60i. Not resolution. Try to keep the dumbness out.
It's actually native 480i. NickHD upscales the broadcast to 720p. I captured the episode at 1080i for the 1080p release.

@chieftain20 Lol fail Face palm. Clearly you both now something about interlace but also you both don't know what it is. As the word says it is Interlaced contrary to progressive. Progressive is simple. Every pixel on every frame is stored is it should be as set of images. Interlaced is that the first only the even rows are stored, on the next frame only the odd rows are stored and when watching the video every frame only the half amount of lines is refreshed. that's where the 540p idea comes from. and your frame rate idea comes from the fact that for the same amount actual image you need twice as many frames on interlaced because only the half is stored. but interlaced sucks cause you can CLEARLY see the lines if something moves quickly. But still lol because you were talking as if you explained a lot.
